review: This drug has relly helped me with the anxiety associatedwith depression. I feel its comparable to the benzos likeKlonopin or ativan, without the risk of addiction associated with taking  benzos
I have had untreatable debilitating anxiety all my life. Too many medications to mention. This medication changed my life. Nurica or Lyrica did not work. Neurontin started working within 2 weeks

This medicine is a miracle drug for my anxiety. The best part of this drug is that it works *just right*. Not too much that you get hooked and not too little that it's a dud. For me, I take citalopram (Celexa) for my anxiety but when I have a panic attack or super bad anxiety gabapentin calms me down in about 30 minutes. No adverse side effects. I used to take an Ativan or Zanax for an anxiety attack and those work *too well* where I would have cravings for the euphoric state. Thank you, gabapentin.
Doesn’t work. Tried high doses and low doses, feel nothing

My experience with gabepentin has been pretty good, I am a drug addict that has been clean for  4 years now, and honestly it has given me my life back. My anxiety since I got off IV meth was so bad I couldn't even leave my house, it was horrible and it made me feel worthless. My MHMR Dr decided to try me on it and it has helped me tremendously. I will say this tho, if I run out before I can see my Dr to get a refill, it's horrible! My anxiety is through the roof. I try not to run out, but it's also really hard bc I am an addict and I have a tendency to overtake everything, even over the counter pm pills but I am working on that.  I know this drug isn't for everyone, but for me it's been great..

Trash. Might work for a month or so then does nothing even with increased dose. It makes anxiety worse and gives you a woozy effect OR literally does nothing. Never know which option it will be but their both trash options lol. This shouldn't even be an option to be prescribed to people tbh
Working well for me. 100mg as needed. My side effects are sweet cravings. It's benefits for me is it help me be calm and help with pain.

One day started feeling terribly horrible after a big event that happened in my life in 2019, so I decided to go to the doctor. They diagnosed me with GAD (Generalized Anxiety Disorder). I have known forever that I had suffered from anxiety but never took any medication until 2019. The doctor prescribed me Gabapentin, but I was reluctant to take it because of my fear of getting addicted to this medication, and brain damage after taking it for a long time, but after reading so many of the comments in this section, I've decided it to give it a try once more time. I took 300 mg today and felt the relief right away, so I'm glad that this medication exists and that I'm able to take it.

I was put on Gabapentin 100g twice daily, and to go up to 200mg in 3 days, and 300mg in a week.  My first dose 100 mg was so - so, with a bit of anxiety but I was able to fight though it. My second dose (100mg) brought a bit more anxiety but I thought it’s not from the drug. It must be me. My third dose (100mg) brought on so much anxiety that I  could not shaking violently. It’s almost like I’m about to have a seizure! I had to call 9-1-1, and took a Clonazapam while waiting for the medics to arrive. I’m happy for those who found comfort in this drug, but it’s not for me. I wish it had worked for me because I can really use peace of mind
Makes me feel stoned all day, helps with anxiety, but still in pain from hip dysplasia, and a few other health issues. A 600 mg dose at bedtime helps with insomnia. Just started med three days ago..

I've been on Paxil and Wellbutrin for anxiety/depression for 21 years.  In general I've responded well to these SSRIs but once in a while when my emotional workload reaches a high level they are not enough.  Strictly as an infrequent intervention Xanax manages to slow things down and restore my functionality,  but it also makes me sleepy and close colleagues have told me they can tell I'm on a benzo.  This year I tried gabapentin instead and found it to be an effective stabilizer without any perceptible side effects.  I've been on gabapentin now for 4 months and it has allowed me to taper the paxil to 10mg daily.  This reduction has restored a degree of sexual functioning.  So far it's all good hear although it is still early in my experience.

I’ve been disabled by anxiety since I was 12. I’m diagnosed borderline and bipolar.  I have experienced sexual assault/abuse more than once, was neglected as a child , tried to commit suicide 5 x in my life. Anyway enough of that. So I take gabapentin 300 2x a day.  One at night and one before I leave the house.  It is calming and takes away that feeling of dread.  I can socialize easier which is great!  So if your life is ruined and controlled by anxiety, please try it.
I suffer from nerve pain and anxiety, while it does degrees the nerve pain it does nothing for my anxiety attacks. Nothing!

Normal! That's all I really want. And gabapentin has helped tremendously.  I have been under pain management for DDD and arthritis in every joint. My last MRI, I was told my spinal above my fusion was "mush".  Before my major deterioration of my spine, eight years ago, I took benzodiazepines(3mg) and Tylenol3. Pain clinic does not allow opiates and benzodiazepines together so my anxiety has been thru the roof. My latest episode of pain incurred with destroying my right arm playing with my 50# puppy. I got nerve pain (ulnar nerve entrapment). Doctor prescribed gabapentin (200x3) and my life has greatly improved. Not only did my nerve pain reduce,  but my anxiety disappeared. After 8 years, I feel calm and less worried. I love my dog.
I’m new to this drug. I will be taking it for Trichotillomania  and fibromyalgia. I came to read the reviews. Thank you
It makes me more open. I actually want to talk to strangers too. It really helps with my depression. The only side effect I noticed was me dropping my phone and keys.

Omg, made me feel uneasy, and caused painful blisters from my waist to my knees to which a dermatologist gave a prescription to clear which made it worse.  Stopped taking it with MD approval, slowly; to stop altogether could cause... well death.

I was prescribed gabapentin about fifteen years ago for restless leg syndrome.  I took 300 mg every night before relaxing for the night, and the restless leg syndrome became a non-issue.  It worked great.  For my ongoing mild depression and anxiety, I had tried a number of things (mostly SNRI), none of which worked for me. Then this past year, I started experiencing some pretty severe anxiety and panic, on a daily basis, and noticed that interestingly, it would resolve each night about an hour after my usual dose of gabapentin.  I would feel relaxed and my mind at relative ease.  I told my doctor this, and learned that yes, it can help with anxiety.  She increased my dose to "as needed" up to three times a day.  Currently I am managing my symptoms at 300 mg twice a day, and it has been like "thank God!".

I experienced a tragedy three years ago when my husband committed suicide in our home. This caused depression, fear, anxiety, and panic attacks. It is more severe now that the two estates are closing and there is not the administrative duties to keep me busy after work. It has been three years of stress and stress induced health issues. I have taken Xanax on occasion when I feel severe anxiety or have a panic attack. My doctor prescribed Gabapentin for my sciatica pain. Right away I noticed a reduction in my anxiety and depression. At first it did make me fuzzy-thinking and slightly dizzy, but that stopped within a week or two. I take 300 mg twice per day - morning and night about 12 hours apart. It helps me to feel more positive and be more productive. I was getting to the point recently where I cried easily and felt self-pity. I feel much better on gabapentin and have hope for the future that I will get my normal life back.

I’ve been on every anti anxiety medication you could possibly think of. Benzos, barbiturates, Buspar, SSRI’s…for 10 years of my life I took benzos daily, switching between benzos every couple of weeks. I finally got off of them and shortly thereafter I was put on Gabapentin. I’m on 600mg 4x a day, and my anxiety is sooo well managed that’s it’s an insane relief. I have tried Gabapentin multiple times in the past with no luck but it works incredibly now. It helps keep me calm, happy, and also helps with my alcohol cravings. I am on other medications but I truly feel like Gabapentin has played a vital roll in my mental health. I’ve tried to lower the dosage and it just ends up with me having more anxiety! The combination I’m on right now works miracles, I’m so thankful.

I'm currently taking neurotin for my anxiety. I take 600 mg 3 times a day and it's really been helping me at work during the day.  The only thing is at night, I get a slight headache and I feel kinda of spaced out. Other than that I rather take neurotin than be dependent on xanax like I used to be.

If you suffer from anxiety, bipolar, PTSD , panic attacks or like me all the above - THIS PARTICULAR MEDICINE WILL BE THE ULTIMATE!!!! I've taken it since 2008. I take 600mg 3x a day. It worked for me very quickly. I've tried so many different medications, all having terrible side effects, not this one. It has 100% been my personal saving grace. I can function completely, can feel all emotions (not that I like to sometimes) it works wonders while not zapping your personality!! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TRYING THIS DRUG, especially if you are hard to treat like I was!

I suffered from social anxiety all my life chronic fatigue and substance abuse tried paroxetine it was not good enough with bad side effects then  my anxiety and degree of depression increased with narcotic discontinuation. I tried gabapentin which was a significant help.  I've been using it now for 4 months with a dose 1200 per day, no side effects except for first 2 weeks it make me more calm.  It  helps with fatigue and also helps for narcotic craving but need psychiatric help with it like 12 steps NA or cbt not drug alone

This is a miracle drug for me. It is not a cure, because the symptoms come back if I don't take it. I experience a 100% reduction in GAD at my current dose taken 3 times a day. Side effects non-existant.At > 1200mg single dose, there is a borderline hypomania experience that told us  that was too high for me. This effect is reproducible as well. Big Pharma is probably scared of this generic drug. My suspicion is it will work better on people with neurological comorbidities, because these people are more likely to have the neurological dysfunction it helps to manage. I will go even further and hypothesize this is related to damaged nerves interfering with processes through calcium gated channels, and its activity related to GABA probably supports this. I have done some research on CGC and neurogenesis that I think is related to thisThis desperately needs clinical research and basic research.

I have been dealing with anxiety, depression, and headache for the past 12 months. This drug works fine with easing the tension and headache. However, one needs to be careful with taking this drug for too long because one's body gets used to it and thus will not have the same effect like before.

I have suffered with anxiety and depression for a long time, not fully understanding what was wrong with me and also self medicating with drugs and alcohol and general avoidance.  Last year it became too much to bare since I had started a new career and was in grad school, moved to a new city and also trying to survive a pandemic.  My doc put my on lexapro which seemed pretty awful to some degree but it wasn’t quite right.  I went to a psychiatrist to see if there might be something more appropriate and she added gabapentin to my lexapro and it was almost instantly so much better. As someone else mentioned below, I am able to be myself and speak without fear of saying the wrong thing, over analyzing every detail and my self consciousness seemed to disappear.  I feel a general sense of peace and calm and my insomnia is gone!  I hope it lasts!

I have crippling anxiety. I’ve tried soooo many other medications. Benzo’s I found myself just too tired to do anything and they made me feel not myself. With gabapentin I somehow feel so relaxed but I also have energy at the same time. And my social anxiety is almost non existent. It’s truly a miracle drug that I wish more people knew about for anxiety!

I first began gabapentin 800 mg three times a day when I was 16 years old. I had horrible anxiety that was constant and caused me to have many issues in school. I would leave school due to panic attacks, and I began to feel suicidal because of how severe my anxiety was. When I began gabapentin my anxiety was completely gone immediately. As a teenager this was god sent and I quickly raised the dose to see if I could feel even more amazing. It not only got rid of my anxiety but also made me feel kinda floaty and buzzing, like a mild high. Anyways, I took this medicine until I was 26 years old. It took me almost 2 years of weaning off it with horrible anxiety and some psychotic tendencies emerging as I cut down. Here I am at the age of 29, and I can say I am still recovering and have very little memory of ten years of my life. Today I struggle with my cognition and short term memory.  I advise anyone not to use this medication unless necessary during the years where your brain is developing.

About 5 months ago I had a major panic attack.  Over the last 5 months I realized I have GAD and depression pretty bad.  I have always had this but it took therapy for me to realize what it was.  I had abused alcohol in the past as a means to cope (6 years sober now).  I tried several medications (Zoloft, Buspirone, Hydroxyzine, Trazodone, and Ativan).  Ativan was a very bad experience.  I had to wean myself off it over a very long period of time and while doing so it gave me panic attacks.  Finally, my psychiatrist asked me to try Gabapentin.  It was almost immediate that it worked for me.  It's a calming effect similar to marijuana but much milder.  It's a very safe drug and not habit forming (physiological at least, I can see it being psychologically addictive).  I've been on it 1 month and this month has been amazing.  Almost seems too good to be true so I'm still a bit skeptical about longer term usage, so we'll see.

So I've been taking gabapentin for anxiety for almost a year I just noticed last week now I've been feeling nauseous my toes have a burning sensation and I've been sweating on my neck a lot. I thought I was taking too much of the medication so I stopped abruptly for 3 days without telling my doctor. Now I started taking it again and I'm still having the same symptoms I don't know what to do I don't know if I should stop taking it again or go to the emergency room please help
Gabapentin made me feel depressed and anxious I'm thinking of stopping it

So I noticed a lot of people post on here as soon as they start taking it great reviews, but then we never hear from them again.  I thought it might be helpful to readers to see how the medicine continues to work for me.  Week 2 : 5 days ago I increased to 300mg 2x day.  At first I felt really anxious after taking it.  I also had a foggy, drunk feeling & blurred vision.  After a couple days most side effects went away.  I still will get very anxious after taking it, sometimes.  This drug is weird.  I feel like there is no consistency, or perhaps my dose is wrong?  For the first time in my life I feel DRUGGED.  There are moments I feel better but don't feel myself?  One night I split my night dose into two 150mg doses.  That was my best night.  I think I will try that again tonight. Good luck to all of you who have Anxiety and Depression.  I have found that anxiety and depression is an addiction, for I am addicted to feeling normal again.

Was prescribed this drug for pain. But I also suffer from depression and anxiety. Well it has been helpful for all three however I’m on a very high dose I think if I was on a lower dose it would not be effective. I take 1200 mg three times a day which is quite a bit. It makes me feel normal in the sense that I am not riddled with anxiety and have much more energy and positivity. It does make you feel a bit like you’re wired on coffee but that’s OK with me

I was prescribed Gabapentin last Monday for anxiety. 100mg 2x a day.  Within the hour I felt a difference.  The anxiety lifted and my mood increased!  I thought I finally found a medicine that worked.  The next couple days I began to feel like myself again  but really wired like I drank a whole pot of coffee.  This lasted until Saturday.  My anxiety and depression started to come back. And today, exactly 1 week later, I feel pretty bad. Anxiety at a 7, Depression at a 3.   I have an appointment tomorrow with my NP to talk about it.  I am assuming she is going to increase the dosage.   I was optimistic when it worked immediately, but now a little disappointed I have to increase it already.  I have read some pretty bad reviews about withdrawal from this medicine so I was hoping to  have relief with a small dosage.  Does anyone else worry about withdrawal if the medicine stops to work?

Gabapentin is highly effective for me calming my anxiety and giving me a sense of control. It is one of those drugs that its effect kick very fast. Yes, like any other medicines gabapentin has side effects depending on the condition of the person. For me I least amount of side effects.

Bipolar II male finally finding out how to take Gabapentin correctly.  Have  painfully suffered most of my life with anxiety and depression.  Was prescribed 3x300 mg. a day in divided doses for anxiety.  Out of convenience I took one dose am and two doses together pm before bed.  What a mistake.  I began taking one of the pm doses with dinner and what a difference that made.  Anxiety and depression GONE!  Bless all of you.

I suffer from Bipolar type 2, chronic anxiety and PTSD. Also addiction disorder. I’ve been on gabapentin for about two months now. When I first started taking it at 300mg 3x a day AS NEEDED I didn’t think it was helping at all, other than feeling dizzy. Then it was increased to 600mg 3x a day SCHEDULED about a month and half later. I’ve been taking it as scheduled for about two weeks and I definitely notice a big difference in my anxiety levels. Anxiety is nearly gone! I wake up in the morning feeling pretty great compared to the past when I would wake up with anxiety as soon as I opened my eyes! I would definitely recommend this medication as a scheduled med. Only drawback is I think it has something to do with my snacking in the middle of the night, which is causing weight gain.

This is the best medication for anxiety that I've ever tried.You know what it makes me feel like?Like when I was a child before I developed anxiety. I spoke freely. I didn't worry about being judged. So now with this med, I'm not analyzing every word that I say before I say it while panicking that I might say the "wrong" thing. I speak freely and comfortably again. I am myself.

I am being treated for treatment resistant depression,  GAD with panic disorder and PTSD.  I have been on many different combinations of meds with no relief.  My psychiatrist recommended a more aggressive approach, electro convulsive therapy.  I went home feeling defeated and cold turkey stopped all my meds.  SUPER BAD IDEA!!  I had very bad "discontinuation effects" they don't call it withdrawals but it very much was.  Luckily I have a supportive husband who helped me find a new doctor. She asked if I had tried gabapentin.  I had never heard of it. I started at 100mg 3 times a day and am currently at 1200mg 3 times a day along with 225mg effexor and 45mg remeron for sleep.  I no longer suffer! I haven't had a panic attack in months and my mood is generally very good.  I love the fact that I can still feel too. I still experience a full range of emotions appropriate for the situation.  I laugh, I cry, I get excited, I get scared.   I feel in control of myself for the first time in years.

I've been taking gabapentin for anxiety, I used to throw up bile and saliva in the middle of the night, along with nausea caused by stress and anxiety, since taking gabapentin before bed, I'm able to sleep and have stopped throwing up. I recommend taking it with a meal. I don't have side effects from it, just makes me tired ,I take 300 mg before bed.

So I have to say gabapentin is by far the best drug  I’ve even been prescribed for anxiety. And I have gone through ALOT of meds. I have bpd, dysthymia and generalized anxiety. It does not knock you out like benzosMakes you calm and yes that comes with a little tiredness but still able to function. Trust me and I am 120 pounds 300mg twice daily.

I was put on gabapentin off-label for anxiety and depression.  I had very very severe side effects to the  gabapentin which got diagnosed as mini strokes, but it was the gabapentin.  I am going thru a very slow wean and having severe withdrawal.  I didn't even have pain before and now I have had neuropathy and am suffering with trigeminal neuralgia.  It is so awful and it may take me a year to get off of this stuff.  I am so mad . I can't work anymore.  It has severely damaged my nervous system and I worry about long term damage.  I was on 900mg daily, which isn't that large a dose.  It has ruined my life.

I had developed anorexia, PTSD, and OCD after a sexual assault. Gabapentin helped me with OCD especially. When I would wake up in the morning, my mind would repeat the same thought over and over and my mood swings were crazy. They wouldn't stop. I started  taking 1/2 of a tablet under my tongue every morning with food. Now my mind is quiet and serene. I feel so joyful and optimistic every day. I'm so productive and motivated at work. This is truly a miracle drug.
I have been on Gabapentin for years at 3600 mg. Works for me as well as the benzos did. I can live at last!

I just got on this gabapentin 300 mg a day and so far I love it. I read tons of info on many, many anti anxiety meds. Was on zoloft  that made it worse with suicide thoughts.  That med can permanently change your brain.  Gabapentin also helps my body pains. Hopefully will stay on this dose although many people take higher daily doses. Been less than a month
I'm on this medication gabapentin for anxiety and severe OCD., in conjunction with my other meds -  I tell my doctor that it has saved me.  It literally is a miracle

Hey, gabapentin has done wonders for me. I can clearly feel the difference between not taking it and taking it. In school my anxiety is a big problem, I couldn’t even look at my classmates, it felt like my body was locked and I couldn’t speak or look elsewhere than my pc. When using gabapentin these problems is just gone, I’m happy, concentrated and very energetic. It is the best

I am someone who has a whole laundry list of problems (bipolar II with psychotic features, depression, generalized anxiety, ADHD, panic disorder, and dpdr) so that means I have to take a ton of medication and have been in therapy since I was 13. I just started gabapentin at 300 mg 3x a day and my anxiety is almost nonexistent. I used to be absolutely paralyzed by fear at random points during the day for seemingly no reason. To the point that all of my muscles would tense and I would feel like they are on fire. This is the only medication that has helped.
Works amazing combined with venlafaxine. It seemed to help overall but taking the two medicines together created amazing clarity and concentration
Helps tremendously with anxiety as well as depression.
I am just now learning gabapentin helps people for so many different issues. Me personally I call it "(My little miracle pill")!

I too went through the awful nightmare  when I quit gabapentin.  In the past I have quit xanax, alcohol, cocaine and a few others and those drugs were a cake walk compared to gabapentin.  I have never felt such anxiety and hopelessness.

I am prescribed 300mg a day but can take up to 600mg. I noticed mood stabilization and anxiety riddance by day 4 or 5. The first week I was extremely high on this medication I even left my phone in a Chinese tea shop and had to turn around no joke. I am now enjoying living on campus at ASU and am getting out more by myself. It is helping me more than my benzo script ever did and I’m in a low dosage! I got a fever as a side effect when I first started but now it is gone.

No bad side effects. The best drug for anxiety next to Ativan.The only weird, but enjoyable side effect was Closed Eye Visuals or CEVs. I would wake in the middle of the night and with my eyes closed, I would see beautiful brightly colored patterns, which I would enjoy until I drifted off to sleep again. I take 600mg 3x per day.

On gabapentin 1 month now.  300 mgs 3 x a day,  off label for anxiety.  So many side effects!!  Blurred and double vision, falling, memory gaps, diarrhea, way too hungry, 12 hour sleeps, ears ringing, and now hands and feet tingling and numb.  Horrible!  Dropped to two doses a day 10 days ago.  Felt better but the tingling had started last 4 days.  Dropped to one dose as of yesterday and going to stop altogether in a couple of days.  Only been a month so not worried about withdrawal, and it’s been gradual enough.  Yes, it knocked out anxiety, but the side effects aren’t worth it.

I've struggled with moderate to severe generalized anxiety for all of my life - mostly related to social and performance situations. I've tried many different drugs and have never been sure that they worked. Then I was prescribed Neurontin, and I can 100% feel the difference. My anxiety has decreased significantly on this drug. It sedates me nicely to the point that I'm still completely alert and myself, but I'm so much more easygoing and relaxed. My physical symptoms related to anxiety are still there but I feel less anxious about them, if that makes sense. It just makes the world much more bearable.There are some negative side effects - such as low sex drive, dizziness (which went away after taking for a few weeks), and sometimes I get extra teary. But it's not much of a price to pay if it helps with the main demon of anxiety!  Drugs affect everyone differently, but if you think your life is negatively affected by anxiety, it's definitely worth trying.

My doctor put me on Gabapentin due to daily headaches. I felt absolutely wasted for the first 3 weeks. Once that had worn off I can’t say it helped my symptoms at all. I had awful nightmares, night sweats and the most intense anxiety I’ve ever felt. I’m now coming off the drug and it’s tough. I wouldn’t recommend this for a long term fix or at all to be honest. It is different for everyone though.

I was rediagnosed after suicidal behavior had me on a hold.I was placed on 400mg 3x daily. The sleeping medication my doctor wished to have me on was denied by insurance and I began to take an extra dose before bed, making sure my psychiatrist knew I'd improvised. She agreed to change my script since it was working.The difference in my life has been incredible. I feel very little anxiety, my behavior is much less problematic interpersonally, and my productivity is through the roof.I'm also on bupropion 300mg XR.I've had almost no side effects. My cravings for alcohol are gone. I'm actually living for the first time in my adult life. The only thing that worries me is the possibility of withdrawal symptoms but it's worth the risk considering the effect it's had.

Took 300mg gabapentin one time for panic attacks and anxiety. My psychiatrist prescribes this to use when anxious symptoms became severe. After several hours I do feel that it helped my anxiety briefly, however I became very drowsy. Once falling asleep I slept very well! Better than most nights. I did wake up around 3am with tremors and hot flashes. My anxiety was full blown and I debated whether to take a Xanax to calm myself down because it was so severe. Made me feel very dizzy, hot, anxious, and made my muscles tense. The rest of the morning I had increased anxiety compared to normal. I will not be taking again. Many reviews state it helped people and wish I could have been so lucky.

I was prescribed neurontin for pudendal neuralgia. I gradually increased from 100 mg three times daily to 300 mg 3x a day. I also take 60 mg duloxetine and 20 mg buspar 2x daily. While my neuralgia didn’t improve, it left me feeling great from reduced anxiety. However, I had to discontinue using it because it significantly impaired my ability to drive safely- I had two near car accidents in two days; and it caused major abdominal bloating in the evening. I am extremely disappointed as I felt better emotionally than I have in years.

I started taking gabapentin, 300 mg 3 times a day, about a month ago.  At first it did a lot for my anxiety, although I experienced a lot of side effects:  dizziness, bloating, weight gain.  I was able to cut way back on my ativan use.  However, the last week my anxiety has shot through the roof and I have had to take gabapentin about every two hours instead of four.  The side effects have subsided, though.  I am going to ask my therapist this Friday whether I should increase my dose or try to get off this drug.

I just started Gabapentin 600mg per day. Not sure if the dosage is low but not experiencing the relief I expected. I don't feel dizzy or nauseous like other medications but I still need my Klonopin to ease the panic attacks. I look forward to this new medication. I'll keep you updated in the near future. By the way, the optimal dose for anxiety is 900 to 1,800mg. But if a lower dose helps you then stick with it. Good Luck to everyone. I hope you find relief from anxiety.

gabapentin works differently for everyone. I took it for anxiety but only  temporarily because of concentration issues. I took 100mg every 6 hours and it helped me for a while. Currently, my anxiety is under control, but my mood is down. A combo of an antidepressant and gabapentin is a perfect match, but it doesn't work for everyone. It will either work or won't. The great thing about this medication is that you don't have to wait several weeks for it to work. It usually works immediately but if your anxiety is high then give it at leasta week and at the right dosage for it to work. Some people can handle 300mg and some people need 1,800mg to be effective. Give it a chance before quitting.

I wasted time with talk therapy and antidepressants.  Then by chance  I took gabapentin for pain when I got shingles.  I noticed that my generalized anxiety went away.  I also sleep a lot better.  I take 200 mg in the morning and 200mg at night.  I had to get used to it - it made me feel fuzzy brained at first. Before gabapentin  I used to like to have a cocktail to calm my nerves.  Now drinking alcohol doesn't even sound good.  I feel calm.  Why isn't this prescribed more?  I had to ask for it.

This definitely helps my social anxiety. Sometimes I don't want to shut up! (lol) However, I don't believe that this will help people with SEVERE anxiety and depression. Anti-depressants would probably work better.I think Gabapentin is more for people who have social anxiety disorder, at least through my experience. It also helps me with my alcohol cravings. My psychiatrist in rehab prescribed me Gaba 2 years ago and I've been on it ever since.I take 600-900mg a day.
gabapentin has been excellent for anxiety

Started off at 300mg 3 x a day for anxiety, depression and insomnia. Didn’t really do much at that level so the psychiatrist increased it to 400mg 3x a day and then upped it to 400mg 4x a day. I used to be on lorazepam for anxiety but stopped taking that because of the side effects. I can tell you with 100% confidence that I’m feeling better on Gabapentin than anything I’ve ever been prescribed for anxiety and depression. I’ve also been sleeping through the night uninterrupted, which I haven’t been able to do for the past 20 years. This stuff works people, as long as it’s at the right dose for your personal needs.
Gabapentin is fantastic for anxiety

This medication gabapentin has been AMAZING for my panic disorder. Within two days of starting gabapentin 300mg x 3 daily I saw incredible improvement. I have had my middle of the day dosage upped to 900mg only because that is when I experience the most anxiety. Only downfall is withdrawal symptoms. I went a couple of days without due to not being able to get my prescription filled and the withdrawal was awful. Shaking, chills, confusion, etc. If you do choose to get off of the medication, follow your doctor's directions and taper off gradually.

The constant bouncing of my legs, the tapping of my fingers, the repetitive rhythmic stuff going on in my head and body and the crippling anxiety all just calmed down or went away. I started at 100mg 3x a day and have now settled into a very comfortable 300mg 3x a day. A little drowsiness at first but my body has adjusted and now I feel no side-effects at all. When I wake up in the morning and the Gabapentin is out of my system I'm immediately aware of the anxiety again but it quickly goes away once I take my morning dose.

I have generalized anxiety disorder and Panic Disorder going on ten years now. I've been on Zoloft the entire time. I had a bad relapse of symptoms this year while on Zoloft. I bumped it up to 200 mg and began taking Gabapentin 300mg/day. I've been doing better, but I'm still working on getting my confidence up after this recent relapse.  Last week I started having anxiety symptoms for a couple of days, so I bumped the Gabapentin to 600mg/day. My anxiety is now better so far. After decades of battling post traumatic stress disorder and anxiety, I finally have found a medication that helps to calm the revved feeling I constantly battle. It is as if someone has loosened their grip on a rubber band!  Best of all, self-help techniques, like relaxation, now work!!  Gabapentin has helped me to feel like I have a fighting chance against anxiety.

I've had anxiety for a years, and panic a lot. I lost my job and partner in the same week (2 weeks before Xmas). Took my first tablet 4 hours ago and already I can think straight, concentrate, and I'm not up tight! Clearheaded.

I have very bad post traumatic stress disorder with severe anxiety. At the beginning of the year, I was diagnosed this medicine for headaches, not anxiety. I did not even tell my doctor about my anxiety since I was used to dealing with it for years on my own. Gabapentin has relatively few side effects - I can be a little dizzy - not much, plus it makes my eyes a little puffy. But it does take the edge off anxiety and can be taken as need, unlike so many other medicines. I take 600mg twice a day.
